skill.name: upgrading-expo
skill.description: Guidelines for upgrading Expo SDK versions and fixing dependency issues
skill.summary: Step-by-step guide for upgrading Expo SDK versions and resolving dependency conflicts
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing Expo SDK upgrade guidelines. All static findings are false positives triggered by code examples and documentation links. No executable code or malicious patterns present.

content.value_statement: Expo SDK upgrades involve complex dependency management and breaking changes. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for upgrading Expo projects including CLI commands, breaking changes checklists, and migration paths for React 19 and New Architecture.
actual_capabilities: Generate Expo SDK upgrade commands using npx expo install
Explain New Architecture requirements and verification
List deprecated packages with official replacements
Provide cache clearing and cleanup instructions
limitations: Does not handle custom native code dependencies

use_cases.title: Upgrade Expo SDK
use_cases.description: Upgrade an Expo project from SDK 52 to SDK 54 with proper CLI commands, dependency fixes, and breaking changes verification.
use_cases.target_user: Mobile developers upgrading existing Expo projects

use_cases.title: Migrate to React 19
use_cases.description: Update React 18 code patterns to React 19 including useContext to use migration, forwardRef removal, and Context.Provider simplification.
use_cases.target_user: React developers adapting code for SDK 54

use_cases.title: New Architecture Migration
use_cases.description: Understand New Architecture requirements in SDK 53+, verify Fabric is active, and troubleshoot native module compatibility.
use_cases.target_user: Experienced Expo developers with native modules

prompt_templates.title: Basic SDK Upgrade
prompt_templates.prompt: Upgrade my Expo project to the latest SDK version. Show me the CLI commands to run and what breaking changes I need to handle.

prompt_templates.title: Specific SDK Version
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to upgrade from Expo SDK 51 to SDK 53. What are the specific CLI commands, what packages changed, and what breaking changes should I check?

prompt_templates.title: React 19 Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me migrate my Expo app from React 18 to React 19 in SDK 54. I need to update useContext hooks, remove forwardRef usage, and simplify Context providers.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Project Upgrade
prompt_templates.prompt: My Expo project is on SDK 50. I need to upgrade to SDK 54, migrate to React 19, enable New Architecture, and clean up deprecated packages. Show me the complete upgrade path with all commands.
prompt_templates.scenario: Full multi-version upgrade with multiple migrations

output_examples.input: What deprecated packages should I remove?

output: React Compiler automatically memoizes components and hooks, removing the need for manual useMemo and useCallback.

best_practices: Run npx expo-doctor after upgrading to identify dependency issues before they cause problems.
Clear caches (node_modules, .expo, Metro) after major SDK upgrades to avoid stale build artifacts.
Review the breaking changes checklist in Expo release notes before upgrading production apps.
anti_patterns: Skipping the breaking changes review and discovering issues only after deployment.
Forgetting to clear native caches when upgrading between major SDK versions.
Using deprecated packages without checking for official replacements in newer SDKs.

faq.question: What is the correct order when upgrading Expo SDK?
faq.answer: First run npx expo install expo@latest, then npx expo install --fix, run npx expo-doctor to identify issues, clear caches, and finally test thoroughly. Address breaking changes before deploying.

faq.question: How do I verify my app uses the New Architecture?
faq.answer: Check if global._IS_FABRIC is defined, or run bunx xcobra expo eval "_IS_FABRIC" in your project. SDK 53+ has New Architecture enabled by default.

faq.question: What happens to AsyncStorage in newer Expo SDKs?
faq.answer: AsyncStorage is deprecated. Use expo-sqlite/localStorage/install instead. The migration path depends on your storage usage patterns and data size.

faq.question: Do I need react-native-worklets for SDK 54?
faq.answer: Yes, react-native-worklets is required for react-native-reanimated to work in SDK 54+. Install it with npx expo install react-native-worklets.

faq.question: Can I use forwardRef in SDK 54 with React 19?
faq.answer: forwardRef is no longer needed in React 19. Pass ref as a regular prop instead: function MyComponent({ ref, ...props }) { return <TextInput ref={ref} {...props} />; }

faq.question: How do I clean up after enabling React Compiler?
faq.answer: React Compiler handles memoization automatically. You can remove manual useMemo, useCallback, and React.memo calls. Test your app to ensure optimization works correctly.
